abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Calub Energy
            Development Project is rated as unsatisfactory,
            sustainability as unlikely, institutional development impact
            as modest, bank performance as unsatisfactory, and borrower
            performance as unsatisfactory. The key lessons learned from
            this project include: 1) This project has three major
            components, which were carried out by different
            institutions. Each organization was responsible for a
            specific component of the project. The overall coordination
            of this project was found difficult and showed a delay in
            some of the activities. Hence, following a decentralized
            approach along institutional specialization in implementing
            such a project can minimize the risk of complexity and
            improve implementation. 2) Bank should have been flexible
            and ready to review the impact of the privatization issue.
            3) The studies conducted came up with important conclusions
            and recommendations which are of importance in solving
            problems connected with the respective fields of study. 4)
            The involvement of local experts in the implementation of
            some studies carried out by international consultants helped
            them gain experience in their respective fields. 5) The
            training and procurement of goods and machinery enhanced the
            capacity of organizations involved in the project to
            implement their respective activities in an enhanced manner.
